title: [K-12] Bayesian Reasoning Competency Enhancement Project Through Conceptual Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic probability theory, statistical concepts, and experience in analyzing social data
context.additional_context: Learners apply Bayesian inference to solve real-world social problems, with emphasis on collaboration and self-directed learning using personal devices

learning_goals: Learners can model complex social data using Bayesian inference to derive prediction results with over 80% accuracy
Learners can explicitly correct their misconceptions identified during problem-solving and incorporate at least three improvements into the final report
Learners can compare the PS-I and I-PS approaches, explaining the strengths and weaknesses of each strategy with situational examples

resources: Social Data Set (Public Institution Open Data)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
